title: 185+ Fun Questions to Ask a Girl You Just Met

steps.title: Ask friendly casual questions to get to know a girl better.
steps.content: Ask friendly casual questions to get to know a girl better. It can be a little nerve-wracking to talk to someone youâ€™ve just met. But if you have a few of these questions ready to go, youâ€™ll always have something to talk about. â€œWhat do you love most about what you do?â€ â€œWhat cheers you up on a bad day?â€ â€œWhat is your favorite movie, and why do you love it?â€ â€œWhat would you do for a living if you didnâ€™t have to worry about money?â€ â€œHow would you describe your perfect day?â€ â€œWhat activities make you feel like time flies?â€ â€œIf you could be famous for something, what would you want it to be?â€ â€œDo you have any big vacation plans?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the most exciting thing youâ€™ve done lately?â€ â€œWhat do you love most about where you live?â€ â€œWhat inspires you when youâ€™re having a rough day?â€ â€œWhat are you looking forward to most this week?â€ â€œWhat are you most grateful for this year?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the best part of your day? â€œWhatâ€™s something people are really surprised to learn about you?â€ â€œWhat do you love most about your friends?â€ â€œWhat are you most proud of in your life?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s something you wish people knew about you?â€

steps.title: Try a few personal questions to learn more about her.
steps.content: Try a few personal questions to learn more about her. Get an idea of who she is by asking questions about her life, background, and family. Finding out basic details about her with the following questions can also help you ease into deeper discussions about things that really matter to both of you. â€œWho was your favorite teacher in school and why?â€ â€œDoes getting older scare you?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your first memory?â€ â€œWhat activities make you feel most alive?â€ â€œWhat was the craziest thing that happened to you in school?â€ â€œWho was your best friend growing up? Are you still friends with them?â€ â€œDid you enjoy growing up in your hometown?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your family like?â€ â€œDid you have a pet growing up?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the worst job youâ€™ve ever had?â€ â€œDo you believe in the supernatural? Why?â€ â€œWhere was your favorite place to go on vacation when you were a child?â€ â€œWhat was your favorite thing to do growing up?â€ â€œWhat are you most passionate about?â€ â€œWhen to you feel most like your true self?â€ â€œDo you think itâ€™s important to have a similar worldview to someone to be close to them?â€ â€œWhen you were a kid, what did you want to be when you grew up?â€ â€œWhat is your most treasured memory?â€

steps.title: Get her to open up with deep, serious questions.
steps.content: Get her to open up with deep, serious questions. Talk about more meaningful subjects to make a deeper connection and build intimacy. If youâ€™re worried about getting too serious or making her uncomfortable with these questions, make sure to tell her itâ€™s okay not to answer. â€œWhatâ€™s the biggest life lesson youâ€™ve ever learned? â€œDo you consider yourself an introvert or extrovert?â€ â€œIs violence ever justified?â€ â€œWhat is the toughest thing youâ€™ve ever had to deal with?â€ â€œWhen is the last time you cried?â€ â€œWho do you feel closest to in your life? Why?â€ â€œHow do you like to be supported when youâ€™re going through something difficult? â€œWhatâ€™s the best advice youâ€™ve ever received?â€ â€œDo you have any passion projects that youâ€™ve always wanted to pursue?â€ â€œWhy do you think people fear death?â€ â€œWhat does it mean to be happy?â€ â€œHow do you define success?â€ â€œHow important is religion or spirituality to you?â€ â€œDo you believe in fate or free will?â€ â€œHow important is it to you to have a family?â€ â€œIs there anything wrong with being selfish?â€ â€œWhat happens when we die?â€ â€œCan we choose our emotions or do they just happen?â€ â€œWhat would happen if we lived forever?â€

steps.title: Pose a thought-provoking question to get her engaged in the conversation.
steps.content: Pose a thought-provoking question to get her engaged in the conversation. Whether you want to start a new conversation or revive one thatâ€™s petering out, posing a compelling get-to-know-you question is the perfect way to get someone chatting. These provocative and insightful questions are also a fun way to learn more about her personality. â€œWhatâ€™s the best book youâ€™ve ever read? Why?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your favorite way to spend your day off?â€ â€œWhat do you think technology will be like in 100 years?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s something no one else knows about you?â€ â€œWhat qualities do you think make someone a good person?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the last TV show you binge-watched, and was it worth it?â€ â€œHow do you think your closest friends would describe you?â€ â€œWhen you picture your life in 5 years, what does it look like?â€ â€œIf you could have any 5 people at a dinner party, who would they be and why?â€ â€œWho has inspired you the most?â€ â€œDo you care what other people think of you?â€ â€œWhere is your happy place?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your go-to comfort watch movie or TV show?â€ â€œWhat are your favorite and least favorite things about yourself?â€ â€œWhat makes you feel the most insecure?â€ â€œWhat type of music are you into?â€ â€œWould you call yourself optimistic or pessimistic?â€

steps.title: Learn more about what she wants in a relationship.
steps.content: Learn more about what she wants in a relationship. Ask her about her relationship goals to decide if youâ€™re looking for the same things. Exploring things like red flags, communication styles, and love languages with these questions can help you see if she's a good match for you. â€œWhat do you think about the idea of soulmates?â€ â€œWhat boundaries are non-negotiable in your relationships?â€ â€œDo you prefer casual or fancy date nights?â€ â€œHow do you handle arguments in relationships?â€ â€œDo you hope to get married someday?â€ â€œWhat do you think your love language is?â€ â€œWhen was the first time you fell in love?â€ â€œDo you prefer monogamy, or open relationships?â€ â€œWhat are the top 3 qualities you look for in a partner?â€ â€œDo you need to have emotional intimacy to enjoy physical intimacy?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the toughest break-up youâ€™ve ever been through?â€ â€œWhat does romance mean to you?â€ â€œDo you think you have a specific â€˜type,â€™ or are you attracted to lots of different types of people?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the biggest relationship challenge youâ€™ve ever faced?â€ â€œHow often do you prefer to be physically intimate when youâ€™re in a relationship?â€ â€œDo you believe in love at first sight?â€ â€œIf you had to describe the feeling of falling in love in 3 words, what would they be?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your communication style in a romantic relationship?â€

steps.title: Show your interest with a flirty question.
steps.content: Show your interest with a flirty question. Donâ€™t be afraid to ask her about her dating history, turn-ons, and more intimate preferences. Use these more direct questions to spice up the conversation and show her youâ€™re interested. â€œWhat was your first impression of me when we met?â€ â€œWhat do you wear to sleep?â€ â€œIf you could plan the perfect romantic date, what would it look like?â€ â€œDo you think youâ€™re a good kisser?â€ â€œHow do you know when you have a crush on someone?â€ â€œWhen was the first moment you realized there was chemistry between us?â€ â€œWhat song puts you in the mood?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your favorite type of kiss?â€ â€œWould you rather be the big spoon or little spoon?â€ â€œHave you ever gone skinny dipping?â€ â€œWhen do you feel most beautiful or attractive?â€ â€œWhat things about me do you find the most attractive?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your biggest guilty pleasure?â€ â€œIf you were me for a day, what would you do?â€ â€œWhat physical qualities do you find most attractive in another person?â€ â€œHave you ever fantasized about me?â€ â€œWhoâ€™s your celebrity hall pass?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s something youâ€™ve always wanted to ask me?â€

steps.title: Make her laugh out loud with a silly question that breaks the tension.
steps.content: Make her laugh out loud with a silly question that breaks the tension. Sharing laughter is a great way to bond in a fun, lighthearted way. [1] X Trustworthy Source Greater Good Magazine Journal published by UC Berkeley's Greater Good Science Center, which uses scientific research to promote happier living Go to source Try delivering one of these goofy questions with a wink and a smileâ€”or a cute emoji for textsâ€”to make them even funnier. â€œWhatâ€™s your least favorite scent?â€ â€œIf you could time travel, where would you go and why?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the most attractive animated character?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the longest youâ€™ve gone without showering?â€ â€œWould you rather be bald or have no eyebrows?â€ â€œIf you could choose any superpower, what would it be and why?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the best prank youâ€™ve ever pulled?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your most useless skill?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the funniest thing you believed in as a child?â€ â€œWhat gives you the ick?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s an embarrassing song or band you secretly love?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the last thing that made you laugh yourself to tears?â€ â€œIf you could fight any historical figure, who would it be?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your biggest irrational fear?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s one inanimate object you would delete from existence?â€ â€œWhat song makes you dance in your chair every time it comes on?â€ â€œWhenâ€™s the most inappropriate time you've laughed at something? â€œWhatâ€™s the creepiest thing you could say to a stranger when passing them on the street?â€

steps.title: Ask an off-beat question to take her by surprise.
steps.content: Ask an off-beat question to take her by surprise. Sometimes, a quirky question that comes out of nowhere can start the best conversation. These random questions are also perfect for changing the subject when youâ€™re running out of things to say. â€œWhatâ€™s the weirdest thing youâ€™ve seen a stranger do in public?â€ â€œWhat do you think cavepeople had nightmares about?â€ â€œIs a hot dog a sandwich?â€ â€œHow could the Wicked Witch of the West bathe if she melts in the water?â€ â€œIf animals could talk, which species would be the rudest?â€ â€œIf you could live in a fictional world from a movie, TV show, or book, which one would you choose?â€ â€œWhoâ€™s the best movie villain?â€ â€œWhat mode of transportation do you hate the most?â€ â€œWhat are your top 3 favorite flavors of ice cream?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the first thing you would do in a zombie apocalypse?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the craziest bet youâ€™ve ever made?â€ â€œIf you could know the answer to one big mystery, what would it be?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the most creative insult you can think of?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the most unnecessary white lie youâ€™ve ever told?â€ â€œDo you think fortune cookie predictions have a time limit?â€ â€œWould you rather have no eyebrows or no eyelashes?â€ â€œIf youâ€™re bald, what hair color gets listed on your driverâ€™s license?â€ â€œIf a word was misspelled in the dictionary, how would someone know?â€

steps.title: Use emojis to make text questions more engaging.
steps.content: Use emojis to make text questions more engaging. Text conversations can come across as a little flat, which can lead to misunderstandings. Make your tone perfectly clear by sprinkling in a few emojisâ€”like in the questions belowâ€”to avoid causing offense. â€œWhatâ€™s the most-used app on your phone?ğŸ“²ğŸ¤”â€ â€œWhat's your favorite movie scene of all time?ğŸ¥ğŸâ€ â€œWhatâ€™s the funniest text youâ€™ve ever gotten?ğŸ¤£â€ â€œWhich meme best represents your life?ğŸ¥¸â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the worst thing that someone could put in their dating app bio?ğŸ«£ğŸ˜â€ â€œHow true do you think astrology is?â™‰ï¸ğŸ”®ğŸ’«ğŸŒ•â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your favorite cheesy pickup line?ğŸ§€ğŸ¤ªâ€ â€œWhatâ€™s the best podcast youâ€™ve ever listened to?ğŸ§â€ â€œWhat would you do if I was there right now?ğŸ˜ˆğŸ˜œâ€ â€œHow do you usually spend your weekends?ğŸ›µğŸŒğŸ¼â€â™€ï¸ğŸ§—ğŸª‡ğŸšµğŸ¼â€â™€ï¸ğŸ¥Œâ€ â€œDid you ever have an imaginary friend?ğŸ«¥â€ â€œIf you could switch lives with a celebrity, who would you choose?ğŸ¤”ğŸ¤©â€ â€œWhat would be the title of your memoir?ğŸ“–â€ â€œAre you scared of horror movies?ğŸ”ªğŸ‘»ğŸ¦‡ğŸª“ğŸ§Ÿâ€ â€œDo you think youâ€™d get along with a clone of yourself?ğŸ‘­â€ â€œWhat emoji reminds you of me?ğŸ§ğŸ¥¸ğŸ˜â€ â€œWhat is your favorite word?ğŸ“–âœï¸â€ â€œWhatâ€™s one thing everyone looks ridiculous doing?ğŸ¤ªâ€

steps.title: Ask her 21 questions that she has to answer honestly.
steps.content: Ask her 21 questions that she has to answer honestly. 21 Questions is a super-easy game thatâ€™s fun and can help you learn more about each other. Think about what you want to know about her, and then jot down a list of 21 questions. Make sure youâ€™re respectful and set some ground rules for what types of questions are off-limits. Then, take turns asking each other questions you have to answer honestly. Try a few of these to get you started. â€œWhatâ€™s the most interesting thing youâ€™ve seen or read this week?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your go-to coffee order?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the best meal youâ€™ve ever had?â€ â€œWould you rather people think you're funny, kind, or smart?â€ â€œWhat would you do if you only had 24 hours to live?â€ â€œIs it worse to be hurt physically or emotionally?â€ â€œWhat is one thing you can't live without?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the funniest nickname you had as a kid?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s something you wish would go out of style forever?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the worst date youâ€™ve ever been on?â€ â€œWhat pickup line do you think would work on me?â€ â€œWho was your first crush?â€ â€œWould you rather people think you're funny, kind, or smart?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s the last thing you bought just for fun?â€ â€œWhat urban legend do you believe in?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s your go-to karaoke song?â€ â€œAre you a morning person or a night owl?â€ â€œWhatâ€™s something you believed as a kid that you were completely wrong about?â€ â€œWhat would you do if you were invisible for a day? â€œWhatâ€™s the best concert youâ€™ve ever been to?â€ â€œIf you could change your name, what would you choose?â€

steps.title: Pose questions that need more than 1 or 2 words to answer.
steps.content: Pose questions that need more than 1 or 2 words to answer. Open-ended questions about her thoughts, feelings, and opinions are a great way to get her to give more meaningful answers and reveal more about who she is and what she values. Asking better questions helps you show youâ€™re interested in her and what she has to say, which may help her to feel more comfortable opening up to you. They can also reduce awkward silences and make people like you more, which helps keep the conversation going . [2] X Research source Once she answers your questions, ask her follow-up questions to learn more about her and keep her talking. For example: â€œHow did you feel about that?â€ â€œWhat did you do next?â€ â€œWhat do you mean by that?â€ â€œWhy do you think that?â€

steps.title: Listen attentively to the other personâ€™s answers.
steps.content: Listen attentively to the other personâ€™s answers. Jean says that one of the best ways to keep a conversation going with a girl is to pay attention to what sheâ€™s saying. Always practice active listening , which is really paying attention to what the other person is saying so you can understand what theyâ€™re feeling. It allows you to better relate to them. This type of listening helps to show respect and build trust, which are both important for building a connection with someone. [3] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Be present in the conversation to be an active listener. That means giving the other person your full attention. Donâ€™t check your phone, and donâ€™t try to think of what you want to say next while they're talking. Maintain natural eye contact with the other person to show they have your attention. You donâ€™t have to stare intently; just stay focused on them. Use friendly, open body language. Subtly lean toward the other person and mirror their body language. An example of mirroring might be taking a sip of water or shifting your weight just after they do.

steps.title: Offer her genuine compliments that focus on what she does.
steps.content: Offer her genuine compliments that focus on what she does. Miller cautions against always focusing on looks. â€œ[A compliment] should be, â€˜Heyâ€¦I really liked your passion when you are working,â€™ or something that you have noticed that can really speak to that person so they feel seen.â€ Tell her what you like about her personality or admire about her accomplishments. Actively listen to what sheâ€™s saying to learn what she values in herself and other people. This tells you what types of compliments are more meaningful to her. Always be sincere and honest when youâ€™re paying a compliment. Authentic compliments just seem to land better than empty flattery. Try to avoid focusing on her appearance or paying overly sexual compliments that might make you seem creepy or rude. If you do compliment her appearance, stick with something like, â€œI really like that dress. The color looks nice on you.â€ This focuses on her sense of style rather than her face or body.

steps.title: Share your perspective and answer questions honestly.
steps.content: Share your perspective and answer questions honestly. Miller says, â€œPeople like you for who you are. I think it's very rare for people to like somebody who's not authentic and not real. So that old clichÃ© of 'be yourself'...it's a clichÃ© for a reason.â€ Always give your genuine opinion or an authentic answer to any question she poses. You donâ€™t have to be perfectly serious with every single answer. But if you answer with a joke, make sure itâ€™s clear youâ€™re just kidding. The goal of these early conversations is to try to find common ground with her to make a connection and see if youâ€™d be a good match. Jean says, â€œPeople are typically more willing to open up to someone if they feel as if they share common passions, viewpoints, and other views.â€ Miller adds, â€œYou don't want to present a false sense of yourself because you want people to like you for the real you.â€
